Once again, we guarantee adequate financing conditions for agribusiness, which segment is a priority for Brazil. #PlanoSafra
Even though we are living in a conjuncture of adjustments, we have made great effort and we are increasing in 20% the resources to finance the next harvest.
It will be R $ 187.7 billion to increase agricultural production and supply both domestic and foreign markets. #PlanoSafra
As in previous harvests, we will continue to expand our support to middle-sized producers. #PlanoSafra
The volume of funds for #Pronamp will be raised to R $ 18.9 billion, with a 25% increase in the funding limit for costing. #PlanoSafra
We persist in our strategy of creating a strong rural middle class, anchored in a competitive and sustainable production. #PlanoSafra
We are making adjustments in the economy, especially in federal government spending. #PlanoSafra

The common goal of all measures is to improve the economic environment and strengthen confidence in the country (...)
(...) for Brazil to grow again in the shortest possible time. #PlanoSafra
We are building a growth agenda, of which this Agricultural and Livestock Plan is one of the components. #PlanoSafra
We are working to stimulate investment and production, to resume growth on a sustainable basis. #PlanoSafra
With this #PlanoSafra, with the new concessions in infrastructure, with the Exportation Plan and with the Agricultural Defense Plan (...)
(...) we are composing a broad agenda of sustainable growth. #PlanoSafra
These initiatives will be joined by #PlanoSafra da Agricultura Familiar and #MCMV 3.
We are working to bring Brazil back on an accelerated growth path, and we want this to happen in the shortest time possible.
We are showing, with concrete actions, that Brazil at the same time makes adjustments and has a very clear agenda for the future. #PlanoSafra
Today, we produce food in quantity and quality p /, with fair prices, guarantee the food security of our population. #PlanoSafra
We are becoming the food barn of the world, and this should be a source of pride for all. #PlanoSafra

PM: 800 years ago, on this day, King John put his seal to a document that would change the world. #MagnaCarta
PM: The limits of executive power, guaranteed access to justice, the rule of law, shouldn’t be imprisonment without trial. #MagnaCarta
PM: What happened here eight centuries ago is as relevant today as it was then. And that relevance extends far beyond Britain. #MagnaCarta
PM: All over the world, people are still struggling to live by the rule of law and to see their governments subject to that law. #MagnaCarta
PM: The countries that have these things tend to be the long term successes. Those who don’t tend to be the long term failures. #MagnaCarta
PM: What is taken for granted here in Britain, is what others are crying out for, hoping for, praying for. #MagnaCarta
PM: This great charter shaped the world for the best part of a millennium helping to promote arguments for justice and freedom. #MagnaCarta
PM: The clauses inspiring those who fought in the English Civil War, giving fuel to the Chartists, succour to the Suffragettes. #MagnaCarta
PM: The seeds sown here have grown throughout the world. In America; in India with Gandhi and South Africa with Nelson Mandela. #MagnaCarta
PM: #MagnaCarta is something every person in Britain should be proud of. Its copies may be faded, but its principles shine as brightly.
PM: Liberty, justice, democracy, the rule of law – we hold these things dear and  they took shape right here by the Thames. #MagnaCarta
PM: So on this historic day, let’s pledge to keep those principles alight. Let’s keep #MagnaCarta alive.

The brothers and sisters published today a message on the state of the state economy and the most important future directions, in order to promote transparency and annuality, and some of these excerpts
2014 is the strongest economic year, with gross output of 1.47 trillion dirhams, non-oil sectors growing 8.1%, GDP 4.6%
Our imports touched 700 billion dirhams in 2014, and the contribution of non-oil sectors in the national economy reached 68.6%. Our goal is to reach 80% in 2021
Our total exports, including re-exports, amounted to AED 376 billion in 2014, and the UAE ranks the Middle East as the largest partner of the world's leading economies
The total wages in our economic sectors reached 410 billion dirhams in 2014, of which 82 billion were in the government sector and the first in the knowledge economy
In 2014, the total value of production amounted to 2.5 trillion dirhams, production in the industrial sector 450 billion, and in construction and construction 295 billion dirhams
20 million tourists to all emirates in 2014, and we are working on infrastructure projects and entertainment facilities tens of billions to double the numbers
We have growth in the financial projects sector by 15% in 2014, and AED 122 billion in its contribution to the country's GDP
Low oil prices spurred positive growth in other sectors, and the conditions surrounding the region have established a unique economic model for the UAE
I would like to take this opportunity, brothers, to call for serious steps to achieve Gulf economic integration to ensure the stability of the entire Arab region
The future of our Arab region depends on achieving a major economic and developmental renaissance led by the Gulf States combined with our brothers and friends
The challenges facing our region need to implement a clear Arab vision, launch huge economic projects and exploit human and natural resources more effectively
Beware of any division project in Lebanon or federalism, it is the project to end Lebanon and to the minimum end Christians in Lebanon.
Today I have published a note on the state of UAE's economy covering also an important direction for the period to come
2014 strongest year for UAE's economy, GDP grow by 4.6% reaching AED 1.47T, non-oil sectors grew by 8.1%
Our imports reached some AED 700B, non-oil sectors contributed 68.6% of GDP, goal is 80% by 2021
Our exports (inclusive of re-exports) reached AED 376B, we continue to lead Middle East as global economies' largest trading partner
Total compensation paid to employees in 2014 AED 410B, incl. AED 82 billion in government sector
National production reached AED 2.5T in 2014, with AED 450B in manufacturing industries, AED 295B in construction sector
20 million tourists visiting the seven emirates in 2014, as we are working on infrastructure projects to double these numbers
Financial sector saw double-digit growth in 2014 of some 15%, with contributions to gross domestic product reaching AED 122B
Decrease in oil prices had positive impact on growth of many economic sectors, and state of region established unique economic model for UAE
Future of Arab World depends on great developmental & economic revival, led by GCC, achieved in cooperation with our brothers and friends.
Regional Challenges demand clear Arab economic vision, big economic projects & effective utilization of human & natural resources

PM speaking live now on the government's One Nation approach.
PM: Whoever you are, wherever you live, whatever your background or stage of life I believe this govt can help you fulfil your aspirations.
PM: I want everyone in this country to have the opportunity to get on & make a good life. That is the task for the next 5 years.
PM: Today I want to make a bigger, & deeper, argument about how we realise the One Nation ideal & help everyone achieve their full potential
PM: The right track to extend opportunity is to recognise the causes of stalled social mobility and a lack of economic opportunity.
PM: This is the change we need - to move from a low wage, high tax, high welfare society to a higher wage, lower tax, lower welfare society.
PM: Families are the best welfare system there is. In the next 5 years we will double free childcare for 3 & 4 yrs olds with working parents
PM: 117,000 families already turned around by the troubled families programme, 400,000 more families over next five years
PM: Next we need to improve ‘coasting schools’. We will turn around 1,000 more failing schools and improve hundreds more coasting schools.
PM: We will help more people back into work and increase the minimum wage to £6.70 from October 2015.
PM: By taking on govt failure & backing family, education & work we extend opportunity & could change the lives of many disadvantaged people
